result.execSummary:
The defendant Terrell Leon Lee was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant ordered to provide ma DNA sample and pay related surcharge  andPay costs and surcharges by 12-18-16.  Non-payment penalty is  civil judgment.

Consecutive to: any other sentence.  
TIME SERVED disposition.
As a convicted felon, defendant may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

records.addlTxt:
Exhibits received and inventoried this date.  
Box 641
cf

Defendant Terrell Leon Lee in court with attorney Thomas J. Flanagan.  Nathaniel Emery Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.    The Court ordered the Defendant to serve 4 DAYS in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence with credit for 4 days time served.  

Court ordered:
* Defendant to pay costs and victim/witness surcharges to be paid by 12/18/2016; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment;
* Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay the related surcharge to be paid by 12/18/2016; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment;

Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored. 

Filed:
- Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
- Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgment

Defendant Terrell Leon Lee in court with attorney Thomas J. Flanagan.  Nathaniel Emery Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.

Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.
